ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.0.2_0: Reverence to him, the Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.2_0: Migāra’s grandson Sāḷha wanted to build a dwelling for the Sangha of nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.3_0: He went to the nuns and said,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.4_0: “Venerables, I wish to build a dwelling for the Sangha of nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.5_0: Please give me nine robes to the monks.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.6_0: At that time four sisters had gone forth as nuns:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.8_0: She’s attractive, good-looking, lovely, of surpassing beauty. She’s skilled and tireless, inquiring work. She’s skilled and diligent, keen, and resolute.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.9_0: After appointing Sundarīnandā to be in charge of building work, the Sangha made her work with Sāḷha.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.10_0: As a consequence of this, Sundarīnandā would often go to Sāḷha’s house to ask for tools,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.11_0: whether an adz, a hatchet, an ax, a spade, or a chisel.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.12_0: And Sāḷha would often go to the nuns’ dwelling place to find out about the progress of the building work.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.13_0: And because they saw each other frequently, they fell in love.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.14_0: But because Sāḷha could not find any opportunity to be intimate with Sundarīnandā, he invited the Sangha of nuns for a meal.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.15_0: When preparing the seats in the dining hall, he counted the number of nuns senior to Venerable Sundarīnandā and placed their seats to one side, and he counted the number of nuns junior to her and placed their seat on the other side.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.16_0: He then placed Sundarīnandā’s seat in a concealed spot in a corner. In this way the senior nuns would think she was seated close to the senior ones and the junior nuns would think she was seated close to the senior ones.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.16_1: Those nuns knew that the senior nuns was seated in the presence of the senior nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.17_0: Soon afterwards he informed the Sangha that the meal was ready.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.18_0: Sundarīnandā thought, “Sāḷha hasn’t prepared a meal for the Sangha as a service, but because he hasn’t been invited by the Sangha of nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.19_0: If I go, I will get into trouble.” She then told a nun who was her pupil, “Go and bring back almsfood for me.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.20_0: If anyone asks about me, tell them I’m sick.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.22_0: Just then Sāḷha was standing outside the gateway, waiting for Sundarīnandā.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.24_0: The nun who was Sundarīnandā’s pupil told him: “She’s sick.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.25_0: Sāḷha thought, “I invited the Sangha of nuns because of Sundarīnandā,”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.26_0: and after telling the people there to serve the meal to the Sangha of nuns, he left for the nuns’ dwelling place.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.27_0: Just then Sundarīnandā was standing outside the monastery gateway longing for Sāḷha.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.28_1: He entered his dwelling and went to the bedroom, and lay down on his couch.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.29_1: and after approaching she said, “Venerable, what’s your sitting mat? Why are you lying down?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.31_0: “What do you mean I don’t desire you?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.32_0: I just couldn’t find an opportunity to be intimate with you.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.33_0: And both having lust, he made physical contact with Sundarīnandā.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.34_0: Just then a nun who was weak from old age and had problems with her feet was lying down not far from Sundarīnandā.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.35_0: She saw how Sāḷha made physical contact with Sundarīnandā while both of them had lust.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.36_0: She complained and criticized her, “How could Venerable Sundarīnandā consent to a man making physical contact with her, when they both had lust?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.38_0: The nuns of few desires, who had a sense of conscience, and who were contented, afraid of wrongdoing, and fond of the training, complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.39_0: “How could Venerable Sundarīnandā consent to a man making physical contact with her,?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.40_1: And the monks of few desires, who had a sense of conscience, and who were contented, afraid of wrongdoing, and fond of the training, criticized her in the same way.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.41_0: After criticizing the nun Sundarīnandā in many ways, they told the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.42_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.43_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Sundarīnandā acted like this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.46_0: “It’s not suitable, monks, it’s not proper for the nun Sundarīnandā, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.47_0: “... How could Sundarīnandā, being lustful, consent to a lustful man consents to a lustful man?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.48_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it or increase the confidence of those who have it,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.49_0: but it will hinder confidence in those without it and it will cause some with confidence to change their minds.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.50_0: And the Buddha spoke in many ways in dispraise of being difficult to support and maintain, in dispraise of great desires, discontent, socializing, and laziness; but he spoke in many ways in praise of being easy to support and maintain, of fewness of wishes, contentment, self-elimination, ascetic practices, serenity, reduction in things, and of being energetic. After giving a teaching on what is right and proper, he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.51_0: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the nuns for the following ten reasons:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.52_0: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad nuns, for the ease of good nuns, for the restraint of corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.53_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:1.54.1_0: ‘If a lustful nun consents to a lustful man making physical contact with her, to touching her, to taking hold of her, to contacting her, or to squeezing her, anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees, she too is expelled and excluded from the community. The training rule on above the knees.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.2_0: whoever, of such a kind, of such activity, of such social standing, of such name, of such family, of such conduct, of such behavior, of such association, who is senior, who is junior, or who is of middle standing—this is called “a”.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.4_0: she is a nun because she lives on alms;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.5_0: a nun because she has gone over to living on alms;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.6_0: a nun because she wears a patchwork cloth;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.8_0: a nun on account of her claim;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.10_0: a nun given the full ordination by going to the three refuges;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.15_0: a nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.16_0: The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.18_0: having lust, longing for, in love with.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.20_0: having lust, longing for, in love with.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.22_0: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of making physical contact.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.36_0: taking hold of a bodily part and then consents.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.38_0: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.40_0: just as a man with his head cut off is unable to continue living by reconnecting it to the body.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.40_1: so too, lustful nun consents to a lustful man making physical contact with her, to touching her, to taking hold of her, to contacting her, or to squeezing her, anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.40_2: Therefore it is called “an offense entailing expulsion”.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.42_0: Community: joint legal procedures, a joint recitation, the same training—this is called “community”.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.1.43_0: She does not take part in this—therefore it is called “excluded from the community”.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.1_0: If both have lust and she makes physical contact with them, below the collar bone but above the knees, body to body, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.2_0: If either of them, with their own body, makes physical contact with something connected to the other’s body, she commits a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.3_0: If either of them, with something connected to their own body, makes physical contact with the other’s body, she commits a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.4_0: If, with what is connected to his own body, he touches what is connected to the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.5_0: If, by releasing something, he touches the body of someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.6_0: If, by releasing something, he touches what is connected to the other monk’s body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.2.7_0: If, by releasing something, he touches what is released by the other monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.3.3_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.3.8_0: if he is overwhelmed by pain;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.3.9_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pj5:2.3.10_0: The first offense entailing expulsion is finished.
